text:

```" Use completion-nvim in every buffer
autocmd BufEnter * lua require'completion'.on_attach()```

text: another thing I noted is that your lua lsp config looks very simplistic... I remember I had a lot of trouble setting it up, and, at the end, the only way to get it working was with a much more verbose config.

text: ok, i got it working without LSP, part of the problem is I copied a line from their docs that seemed to be breaking everything

text:
relevant lines here
```autocmd BufEnter * lua require'completion'.on_attach()
let g:completion_enable_snippet = 'UltiSnips'
let g:completion_enable_auto_popup = 1
au Filetype lua setl omnifunc=v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc
nnoremap <Leader>ct :CompletionToggle<CR>
let g:completion_auto_change_source = 1
let g:completion_matching_strategy_list = ['exact', 'substring', 'fuzzy', 'all']```

elements.text: relevant lines here

autocmd BufEnter * lua require'completion'.on_attach()
let g:completion_enable_snippet = 'UltiSnips'
let g:completion_enable_auto_popup = 1
au Filetype lua setl omnifunc=v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc
nnoremap <Leader>ct :CompletionToggle<CR>
let g:completion_auto_change_source = 1
let g:completion_matching_strategy_list = ['exact', 'substring', 'fuzzy', 'all']

text:
So I had to define the following:
```" Assign dummy keys (expand trigger and list snippets are taken care of by completion-nvim)
let g:UltiSnipsExpandTrigger       = "<\>"
let g:UltiSnipsListSnippets        = "<\>"```
